trans-unit.source: How to use In-Role Cache (.NET) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to use In-Role Cache (.NET) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure In-Role Cache. The samples are written in C# code and use the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure In-Role Cache. The samples are written in C# code and use the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: How to Use In-Role Cache for Azure Cache
trans-unit.target: How to Use In-Role Cache for Azure Cache

trans-unit.source: This guide shows you how to get started using
trans-unit.target: This guide shows you how to get started using

trans-unit.source: In-Role Cache for Azure Cache.
trans-unit.target: In-Role Cache for Azure Cache.

trans-unit.source: The samples are written in C\# code and
trans-unit.target: The samples are written in C\# code and

trans-unit.source: use the .NET API.
trans-unit.target: use the .NET API.

trans-unit.source: The scenarios covered include configuring a cache cluster, configuring cache clients, **adding and removing
trans-unit.target: The scenarios covered include configuring a cache cluster, configuring cache clients, **adding and removing

trans-unit.source: objects from the cache, storing ASP.NET session state in the cache**,
trans-unit.target: objects from the cache, storing ASP.NET session state in the cache**,

trans-unit.source: and enabling ASP.NET page output caching using the cache.
trans-unit.target: and enabling ASP.NET page output caching using the cache.

trans-unit.source: For more
trans-unit.target: For more

trans-unit.source: information on using In-Role Cache, refer to the <link><linkText>Next Steps[]</linkText><title></title></link> section.
trans-unit.target: information on using In-Role Cache, refer to the <link><linkText>Next Steps[]</linkText><title></title></link> section.

trans-unit.source: For guidance on choosing the right Azure Cache offering for your application, see <link><linkText>Which Azure Cache offering is right for me?[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For guidance on choosing the right Azure Cache offering for your application, see <link><linkText>Which Azure Cache offering is right for me?[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: What is In-Role Cache?
trans-unit.target: What is In-Role Cache?

trans-unit.source: In-Role Cache provides a caching layer to your Azure applications.
trans-unit.target: In-Role Cache provides a caching layer to your Azure applications.

trans-unit.source: Caching increases performance by temporarily storing information in-memory from
trans-unit.target: Caching increases performance by temporarily storing information in-memory from

trans-unit.source: other backend sources, and can reduce the costs associated with database
trans-unit.target: other backend sources, and can reduce the costs associated with database

trans-unit.source: transactions in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: transactions in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: In-Role Cache includes the following
trans-unit.target: In-Role Cache includes the following

trans-unit.source: features:
trans-unit.target: features:

trans-unit.source: Pre-built ASP.NET providers for session state and page output
trans-unit.target: Pre-built ASP.NET providers for session state and page output

trans-unit.source: caching, enabling acceleration of web applications without having to
trans-unit.target: caching, enabling acceleration of web applications without having to

trans-unit.source: modify application code.
trans-unit.target: modify application code.

trans-unit.source: Caches any serializable managed object - for example: CLR objects, rows, XML,
trans-unit.target: Caches any serializable managed object - for example: CLR objects, rows, XML,

trans-unit.source: binary data.
trans-unit.target: binary data.

trans-unit.source: Consistent development model across both Azure and Windows
trans-unit.target: Consistent development model across both Azure and Windows

trans-unit.source: Server AppFabric.
trans-unit.target: Server AppFabric.

trans-unit.source: In-Role Cache provides a way to perform caching by using a portion of the memory of the virtual machines that host the role instances in your Azure cloud services (also known as hosted services).
trans-unit.target: In-Role Cache provides a way to perform caching by using a portion of the memory of the virtual machines that host the role instances in your Azure cloud services (also known as hosted services).

trans-unit.source: You have greater flexibility in terms of deployment options, the caches can be very large in size and have no cache specific quota restrictions.
trans-unit.target: You have greater flexibility in terms of deployment options, the caches can be very large in size and have no cache specific quota restrictions.

trans-unit.source: Starting with Azure SDK 2.6, In-Role Cache is using Microsoft Azure Storage SDK version 4.3.
trans-unit.target: Starting with Azure SDK 2.6, In-Role Cache is using Microsoft Azure Storage SDK version 4.3.

trans-unit.source: In previous versions of the Azure SDK, In-Role Cache used Azure Storage SDK 1.7.
trans-unit.target: In previous versions of the Azure SDK, In-Role Cache used Azure Storage SDK 1.7.

trans-unit.source: Applications using In-Role Cache with versions of the Azure SDK before 2.6 should migrate to Azure SDK 2.6 before Azure Storage version 2011-08-18 is decommissioned on December 9th, 2015.
trans-unit.target: Applications using In-Role Cache with versions of the Azure SDK before 2.6 should migrate to Azure SDK 2.6 before Azure Storage version 2011-08-18 is decommissioned on December 9th, 2015.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure SDK 2.6 Release Notes - In-Role Cache</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Storage Service Version Removal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Azure SDK 2.6 Release Notes - In-Role Cache</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Storage Service Version Removal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Caching on role instances has the following advantages:
trans-unit.target: Caching on role instances has the following advantages:

trans-unit.source: Pay no premium for caching.
trans-unit.target: Pay no premium for caching.

trans-unit.source: You pay only for the compute resources that host the cache.
trans-unit.target: You pay only for the compute resources that host the cache.

trans-unit.source: Eliminates cache quotas and throttling.
trans-unit.target: Eliminates cache quotas and throttling.

trans-unit.source: Offers greater control and isolation.
trans-unit.target: Offers greater control and isolation.

trans-unit.source: Improved performance.
trans-unit.target: Improved performance.

trans-unit.source: Automatically sizes caches when roles are scaled in or out.
trans-unit.target: Automatically sizes caches when roles are scaled in or out.

trans-unit.source: Effectively scales the memory that is available for caching up or down when role instances are added or removed.
trans-unit.target: Effectively scales the memory that is available for caching up or down when role instances are added or removed.

trans-unit.source: Provides full-fidelity development time debugging.
trans-unit.target: Provides full-fidelity development time debugging.

trans-unit.source: Supports the memcache protocol.
trans-unit.target: Supports the memcache protocol.

trans-unit.source: In addition, caching on role instances offers these configurable options:
trans-unit.target: In addition, caching on role instances offers these configurable options:

trans-unit.source: Configure a dedicated role for caching, or co-locate caching on existing roles.
trans-unit.target: Configure a dedicated role for caching, or co-locate caching on existing roles.

trans-unit.source: Make your cache available to multiple clients in the same cloud service deployment.
trans-unit.target: Make your cache available to multiple clients in the same cloud service deployment.

trans-unit.source: Create multiple named caches with different properties.
trans-unit.target: Create multiple named caches with different properties.

trans-unit.source: Optionally configure high availability on individual caches.
trans-unit.target: Optionally configure high availability on individual caches.

trans-unit.source: Use expanded caching capabilities such as regions, tagging, and notifications.
trans-unit.target: Use expanded caching capabilities such as regions, tagging, and notifications.

trans-unit.source: This guide provides an overview of getting started with In-Role Cache.
trans-unit.target: This guide provides an overview of getting started with In-Role Cache.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information on these features that are beyond the scope of this getting started guide, see <link><linkText>Overview of In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information on these features that are beyond the scope of this getting started guide, see <link><linkText>Overview of In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Getting Started with In-Role Cache
trans-unit.target: Getting Started with In-Role Cache

trans-unit.source: In-Role Cache provides a way to enable caching using the memory that is on the virtual machines that host your role instances.
trans-unit.target: In-Role Cache provides a way to enable caching using the memory that is on the virtual machines that host your role instances.

trans-unit.source: The role instances that host your caches are known as a cache cluster.
trans-unit.target: The role instances that host your caches are known as a cache cluster.

trans-unit.source: There are two deployment topologies for caching on role instances:
trans-unit.target: There are two deployment topologies for caching on role instances:

trans-unit.source: Dedicated Role caching - The role instances are used exclusively for caching.
trans-unit.target: Dedicated Role caching - The role instances are used exclusively for caching.

trans-unit.source: Co-located Role caching - The cache shares the VM resources (bandwidth, CPU, and memory) with the application.
trans-unit.target: Co-located Role caching - The cache shares the VM resources (bandwidth, CPU, and memory) with the application.

trans-unit.source: To use caching on role instances, you need to configure a cache cluster, and then configure the cache clients so they can access the cache cluster.
trans-unit.target: To use caching on role instances, you need to configure a cache cluster, and then configure the cache clients so they can access the cache cluster.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configure the cache cluster[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configure the cache cluster[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Configure the cache clients[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Configure the cache clients[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Configure the cache cluster
trans-unit.target: Configure the cache cluster

trans-unit.source: To configure a Co-located Role cache cluster, select the role in which you wish to host the cache cluster.
trans-unit.target: To configure a Co-located Role cache cluster, select the role in which you wish to host the cache cluster.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the role properties in Solution Explorer and choose Properties.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the role properties in Solution Explorer and choose Properties.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Caching tab, check the Enable Caching checkbox, and specify the desired caching options.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Caching tab, check the Enable Caching checkbox, and specify the desired caching options.

trans-unit.source: When caching is enabled in a Worker Role or ASP.NET Web Role, the default configuration is Co-located Role caching with 30% of the memory of the role instances allocated for caching.
trans-unit.target: When caching is enabled in a Worker Role or ASP.NET Web Role, the default configuration is Co-located Role caching with 30% of the memory of the role instances allocated for caching.

trans-unit.source: A default cache is automatically configured, and additional named caches can be created if desired, and these caches will share the allocated memory.
trans-unit.target: A default cache is automatically configured, and additional named caches can be created if desired, and these caches will share the allocated memory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To configure a Dedicated Role cache cluster, add a Cache Worker Role to your project.
trans-unit.target: To configure a Dedicated Role cache cluster, add a Cache Worker Role to your project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache7</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache7</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When a Cache Worker Role is added to a project, the default configuration is Dedicated Role caching.
trans-unit.target: When a Cache Worker Role is added to a project, the default configuration is Dedicated Role caching.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache8</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache8</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Once caching is enabled, the cache cluster storage account can be configured.
trans-unit.target: Once caching is enabled, the cache cluster storage account can be configured.

trans-unit.source: In-Role Cache requires an Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: In-Role Cache requires an Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: This storage account is used to hold configuration data about the cache cluster that is accessed from all virtual machines that make up the cache cluster.
trans-unit.target: This storage account is used to hold configuration data about the cache cluster that is accessed from all virtual machines that make up the cache cluster.

trans-unit.source: This storage account is specified on the Caching tab of the cache cluster role property page, just above the Named Cache Settings.
trans-unit.target: This storage account is specified on the Caching tab of the cache cluster role property page, just above the Named Cache Settings.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache10</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache10</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If this storage account is not configured the roles will fail to start.
trans-unit.target: If this storage account is not configured the roles will fail to start.

trans-unit.source: The size of the cache is determined by a combination of the VM size of the role, the instance count of the role, and whether the cache cluster is configured as a dedicated role or co-located role cache cluster.
trans-unit.target: The size of the cache is determined by a combination of the VM size of the role, the instance count of the role, and whether the cache cluster is configured as a dedicated role or co-located role cache cluster.

trans-unit.source: This section provides a simplified overview on configuring the cache size.
trans-unit.target: This section provides a simplified overview on configuring the cache size.

trans-unit.source: For more information on cache size and other capacity planning considerations, see <link><linkText>In-Role Cache Capacity Planning Considerations[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on cache size and other capacity planning considerations, see <link><linkText>In-Role Cache Capacity Planning Considerations[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To configure the virtual machine size and the number of role instances, right-click the role properties in Solution Explorer and choose Properties.
trans-unit.target: To configure the virtual machine size and the number of role instances, right-click the role properties in Solution Explorer and choose Properties.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Switch to the Configuration tab.
trans-unit.target: Switch to the Configuration tab.

trans-unit.source: The default Instance count is 1, and the default VM size is Small.
trans-unit.target: The default Instance count is 1, and the default VM size is Small.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The total memory for the VM sizes is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The total memory for the VM sizes is as follows:

trans-unit.source: Small: 1.75 GB
trans-unit.target: Small: 1.75 GB

trans-unit.source: Medium: 3.5 GB
trans-unit.target: Medium: 3.5 GB

trans-unit.source: Large: 7 GB
trans-unit.target: Large: 7 GB

trans-unit.source: ExtraLarge: 14 GB
trans-unit.target: ExtraLarge: 14 GB

trans-unit.source: These memory sizes represent the total amount of memory available to the VM which is shared across the OS, cache process, cache data, and application.
trans-unit.target: These memory sizes represent the total amount of memory available to the VM which is shared across the OS, cache process, cache data, and application.

trans-unit.source: For more information on configuring Virtual Machine Sizes, see <link><linkText>How to Configure Virtual Machine Sizes[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on configuring Virtual Machine Sizes, see <link><linkText>How to Configure Virtual Machine Sizes[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Note that cache is unsupported on ExtraSmall VM sizes.
trans-unit.target: Note that cache is unsupported on ExtraSmall VM sizes.

trans-unit.source: When Co-located Role caching is specified, the cache size is determined by taking the specified percentage of the virtual machine memory.
trans-unit.target: When Co-located Role caching is specified, the cache size is determined by taking the specified percentage of the virtual machine memory.

trans-unit.source: When Dedicated Role caching is specified, all of the available memory of the virtual machine is used for caching.
trans-unit.target: When Dedicated Role caching is specified, all of the available memory of the virtual machine is used for caching.

trans-unit.source: If two role instances are configured, the combined memory of the virtual machines is used.
trans-unit.target: If two role instances are configured, the combined memory of the virtual machines is used.

trans-unit.source: This forms a cache cluster where the available caching memory is distributed across multiple role instances but presented to the clients of the cache as a single resource.
trans-unit.target: This forms a cache cluster where the available caching memory is distributed across multiple role instances but presented to the clients of the cache as a single resource.

trans-unit.source: Configuring additional role instances increases the cache size in the same manner.
trans-unit.target: Configuring additional role instances increases the cache size in the same manner.

trans-unit.source: To determine the settings needed to provision a cache of the desired size, you can use the Capacity Planning Spreadsheet which is covered in <link><linkText>In-Role Cache Capacity Planning Considerations[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To determine the settings needed to provision a cache of the desired size, you can use the Capacity Planning Spreadsheet which is covered in <link><linkText>In-Role Cache Capacity Planning Considerations[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Once the cache cluster is configured, you can configure the cache clients to allow access to the cache.
trans-unit.target: Once the cache cluster is configured, you can configure the cache clients to allow access to the cache.

trans-unit.source: Configure the cache clients
trans-unit.target: Configure the cache clients

trans-unit.source: To access a In-Role Cache cache, the clients must be within the same deployment.
trans-unit.target: To access a In-Role Cache cache, the clients must be within the same deployment.

trans-unit.source: If the cache cluster is a dedicated role cache cluster, then the clients are other roles in the deployment.
trans-unit.target: If the cache cluster is a dedicated role cache cluster, then the clients are other roles in the deployment.

trans-unit.source: If the cache cluster is a co-located role cache cluster, then the clients could be either the other roles in the deployment, or the roles themselves that host the cache cluster.
trans-unit.target: If the cache cluster is a co-located role cache cluster, then the clients could be either the other roles in the deployment, or the roles themselves that host the cache cluster.

trans-unit.source: A NuGet package is provided that can be used to configure each client role that accesses the cache.
trans-unit.target: A NuGet package is provided that can be used to configure each client role that accesses the cache.

trans-unit.source: To configure a role to access a cache cluster using the Caching NuGet package, right-click the role project in Solution Explorer and choose Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: To configure a role to access a cache cluster using the Caching NuGet package, right-click the role project in Solution Explorer and choose Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache4</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache4</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select In-Role Cache, click Install, and then click I Accept.
trans-unit.target: Select In-Role Cache, click Install, and then click I Accept.

trans-unit.source: If In-Role Cache does not appear in the list type WindowsAzure.Caching into the Search Online text box and select it from the results.
trans-unit.target: If In-Role Cache does not appear in the list type WindowsAzure.Caching into the Search Online text box and select it from the results.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache5</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache5</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package does several things: it adds the required configuration to the config file of the role, it adds a cache client diagnostic level setting to the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file of the Azure application, and it adds the required assembly references.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package does several things: it adds the required configuration to the config file of the role, it adds a cache client diagnostic level setting to the ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file of the Azure application, and it adds the required assembly references.

trans-unit.source: For ASP.NET web roles, the Caching NuGet package also adds two commented out sections to web.config.
trans-unit.target: For ASP.NET web roles, the Caching NuGet package also adds two commented out sections to web.config.

trans-unit.source: The first section enables session state to be stored in the cache, and the second section enables ASP.NET page output caching.
trans-unit.target: The first section enables session state to be stored in the cache, and the second section enables ASP.NET page output caching.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [How To: Store ASP.NET Session State in the Cache] and <link><linkText>How To: Store ASP.NET Page Output Caching in the Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [How To: Store ASP.NET Session State in the Cache] and <link><linkText>How To: Store ASP.NET Page Output Caching in the Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package adds the following configuration elements into your role's web.config or app.config.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package adds the following configuration elements into your role's web.config or app.config.

trans-unit.source: A dataCacheClients section and a cacheDiagnostics section are added under the configSections element.
trans-unit.target: A dataCacheClients section and a cacheDiagnostics section are added under the configSections element.

trans-unit.source: If there is no configSections element present, one is created as a child of the configuration element.
trans-unit.target: If there is no configSections element present, one is created as a child of the configuration element.

trans-unit.source: These new sections include references to a dataCacheClients element and a cacheDiagnostics element.
trans-unit.target: These new sections include references to a dataCacheClients element and a cacheDiagnostics element.

trans-unit.source: These elements are also added to the configuration element.
trans-unit.target: These elements are also added to the configuration element.

trans-unit.source: After the configuration is added, replace [cache cluster role name] with the name of the role that hosts the cache cluster.
trans-unit.target: After the configuration is added, replace [cache cluster role name] with the name of the role that hosts the cache cluster.

trans-unit.source: If [cache cluster role name] is not replaced with the name of the role that hosts the cache cluster, then a TargetInvocationException will be thrown when the cache is accessed with an inner DatacacheException with the message "No such role exists".
trans-unit.target: If [cache cluster role name] is not replaced with the name of the role that hosts the cache cluster, then a TargetInvocationException will be thrown when the cache is accessed with an inner DatacacheException with the message "No such role exists".

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package also adds a ClientDiagnosticLevel setting to the ConfigurationSettings of the cache client role in ServiceConfiguration.cscfg.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package also adds a ClientDiagnosticLevel setting to the ConfigurationSettings of the cache client role in ServiceConfiguration.cscfg.

trans-unit.source: The following example is the WebRole1 section from a ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file with a ClientDiagnosticLevel of 1, which is the default ClientDiagnosticLevel.
trans-unit.target: The following example is the WebRole1 section from a ServiceConfiguration.cscfg file with a ClientDiagnosticLevel of 1, which is the default ClientDiagnosticLevel.

trans-unit.source: In-Role Cache provides both a cache server and a cache client diagnostic level.
trans-unit.target: In-Role Cache provides both a cache server and a cache client diagnostic level.

trans-unit.source: The diagnostic level is a single setting that configures the level of diagnostic information collected for caching.
trans-unit.target: The diagnostic level is a single setting that configures the level of diagnostic information collected for caching.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Troubleshooting and Diagnostics for In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Troubleshooting and Diagnostics for In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package also adds references to the following assemblies:
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package also adds references to the following assemblies:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.Client.dll
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.Client.dll

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.Core.dll
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.Core.dll

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.WindowsFabric.Common.dll
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.WindowsFabric.Common.dll

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.WindowsFabric.Data.Common.dll
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.WindowsFabric.Data.Common.dll

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.AzureCommon.dll
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.AzureCommon.dll

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.AzureClientHelper.dll
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationServer.Caching.AzureClientHelper.dll

trans-unit.source: If your role is an ASP.NET Web Role, the following assembly reference is also added:
trans-unit.target: If your role is an ASP.NET Web Role, the following assembly reference is also added:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.Web.DistributedCache.dll.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.Web.DistributedCache.dll.

trans-unit.source: Once your client project is configured for caching, you can use the techniques described in the following sections for working with your cache.
trans-unit.target: Once your client project is configured for caching, you can use the techniques described in the following sections for working with your cache.

trans-unit.source: Working with Caches
trans-unit.target: Working with Caches

trans-unit.source: The steps in this section describe how to perform common tasks with caching.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this section describe how to perform common tasks with caching.

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>How To: Create a DataCache Object[]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How To: Create a DataCache Object[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How To: Add and Retrieve an Object from the Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How To: Specify the Expiration of an Object in the Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How To: Store ASP.NET Session State in the Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>How To: Store ASP.NET Page Output Caching in the Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: How To: Create a DataCache Object
trans-unit.target: How To: Create a DataCache Object

trans-unit.source: In order to programatically work with a cache, you need a reference to the cache.
trans-unit.target: In order to programatically work with a cache, you need a reference to the cache.

trans-unit.source: Add the following to the top of any file from which you want to use
trans-unit.target: Add the following to the top of any file from which you want to use

trans-unit.source: In-Role Cache:
trans-unit.target: In-Role Cache:

trans-unit.source: If Visual Studio doesn't recognize the types in the using
trans-unit.target: If Visual Studio doesn't recognize the types in the using

trans-unit.source: statement even after installing the Caching NuGet package, which adds the necessary references, ensure that the target
trans-unit.target: statement even after installing the Caching NuGet package, which adds the necessary references, ensure that the target

trans-unit.source: profile for the project is .NET Framework 4.0 or higher, and be sure to select one of the profiles that does not specify Client Profile.
trans-unit.target: profile for the project is .NET Framework 4.0 or higher, and be sure to select one of the profiles that does not specify Client Profile.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on configuring cache clients, see <link><linkText>Configure the cache clients[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on configuring cache clients, see <link><linkText>Configure the cache clients[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: There are two ways to create a DataCache object.
trans-unit.target: There are two ways to create a DataCache object.

trans-unit.source: The first way is to simply create a DataCache, passing in the name of the desired cache.
trans-unit.target: The first way is to simply create a DataCache, passing in the name of the desired cache.

trans-unit.source: Once the DataCache is instantiated, you can use it to interact with the cache, as described in the following sections.
trans-unit.target: Once the DataCache is instantiated, you can use it to interact with the cache, as described in the following sections.

trans-unit.source: To use the second way, create a new DataCacheFactory object in your application using the default constructor.
trans-unit.target: To use the second way, create a new DataCacheFactory object in your application using the default constructor.

trans-unit.source: This causes the cache client to use the settings in the configuration file.
trans-unit.target: This causes the cache client to use the settings in the configuration file.

trans-unit.source: Call either the GetDefaultCache method of the new DataCacheFactory instance which returns a DataCache object, or the GetCache method and pass in the name of your cache.
trans-unit.target: Call either the GetDefaultCache method of the new DataCacheFactory instance which returns a DataCache object, or the GetCache method and pass in the name of your cache.

trans-unit.source: These methods return a DataCache object that can then be used to programmatically access the cache.
trans-unit.target: These methods return a DataCache object that can then be used to programmatically access the cache.

trans-unit.target: How To: Add and Retrieve an Object from the Cache

trans-unit.target: To add an item to the cache, the Add method or the Put method

trans-unit.source: can be used.
trans-unit.target: can be used.

trans-unit.target: The Add method adds the specified object to the cache,

trans-unit.source: keyed by the value of the key parameter.
trans-unit.target: keyed by the value of the key parameter.

trans-unit.target: If an object with the same key is already in the cache, a

trans-unit.target: DataCacheException will be thrown with the following message:

trans-unit.target: ErrorCode:SubStatus: An attempt is being made to create an object with

trans-unit.target: a Key that already exists in the cache.

trans-unit.target: If the object exists, it is

trans-unit.target: The Put method adds the object with the specified key to the cache

trans-unit.source: How To: Specify the Expiration of an Object in the Cache
trans-unit.target: How To: Specify the Expiration of an Object in the Cache

trans-unit.source: By default items in the cache expire 10 minutes after they are placed in the cache.
trans-unit.target: By default items in the cache expire 10 minutes after they are placed in the cache.

trans-unit.source: This can be configured in the Time to Live (min) setting in the role properties of the role that hosts the cache cluster.
trans-unit.target: This can be configured in the Time to Live (min) setting in the role properties of the role that hosts the cache cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>RoleCache6</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>RoleCache6</linkText>

trans-unit.source: There are three types of Expiration Type: None, Absolute, and Sliding Window.
trans-unit.target: There are three types of Expiration Type: None, Absolute, and Sliding Window.

trans-unit.source: These configure how Time to Live (min) is used to determine expiration.
trans-unit.target: These configure how Time to Live (min) is used to determine expiration.

trans-unit.source: The default Expiration Type is Absolute, which means that the countdown timer for an item's expiration begins when the item is placed into the cache.
trans-unit.target: The default Expiration Type is Absolute, which means that the countdown timer for an item's expiration begins when the item is placed into the cache.

trans-unit.source: Once the specified amount of time has elapsed for an item, the item expires.
trans-unit.target: Once the specified amount of time has elapsed for an item, the item expires.

trans-unit.source: If Sliding Window is specified, then the expiration countdown for an item is reset each time the item is accessed in the cache, and the item will not expire until the specified amount of time has elapsed since its last access.
trans-unit.target: If Sliding Window is specified, then the expiration countdown for an item is reset each time the item is accessed in the cache, and the item will not expire until the specified amount of time has elapsed since its last access.

trans-unit.source: If None is specified, then Time to Live (min) must be set to 0, and items will not expire, and will remain valid as long as they are in the cache.
trans-unit.target: If None is specified, then Time to Live (min) must be set to 0, and items will not expire, and will remain valid as long as they are in the cache.

trans-unit.source: If a longer or shorter timeout interval than what is configured in the role properties is desired, a specific duration can be specified when an item is added or updated in the cache by using the
trans-unit.target: If a longer or shorter timeout interval than what is configured in the role properties is desired, a specific duration can be specified when an item is added or updated in the cache by using the

trans-unit.source: overload of Add and Put that take a TimeSpan parameter.
trans-unit.target: overload of Add and Put that take a TimeSpan parameter.

trans-unit.source: In
trans-unit.target: In

trans-unit.target: the following example, the string value is added to cache, keyed by

trans-unit.source: item, with a timeout of 30 minutes.
trans-unit.target: item, with a timeout of 30 minutes.

trans-unit.target: To view the remaining timeout interval of an item in the cache, the

trans-unit.source: GetCacheItem method can be used to retrieve a DataCacheItem
trans-unit.target: GetCacheItem method can be used to retrieve a DataCacheItem

trans-unit.source: object that contains information about the item in the cache, including
trans-unit.target: object that contains information about the item in the cache, including

trans-unit.source: the remaining timeout interval.
trans-unit.target: the remaining timeout interval.

trans-unit.source: How To: Store ASP.NET Session State in the Cache
trans-unit.target: How To: Store ASP.NET Session State in the Cache

trans-unit.source: The Session State Provider for In-Role Cache is an
trans-unit.target: The Session State Provider for In-Role Cache is an

trans-unit.source: out-of-process storage mechanism for ASP.NET applications.
trans-unit.target: out-of-process storage mechanism for ASP.NET applications.

trans-unit.source: This provider
trans-unit.target: This provider

trans-unit.source: enables you to store your session state in an Azure cache rather
trans-unit.target: enables you to store your session state in an Azure cache rather

trans-unit.source: than in-memory or in a SQL Server database.
trans-unit.target: than in-memory or in a SQL Server database.

trans-unit.source: To use the caching session
trans-unit.target: To use the caching session

trans-unit.source: state provider, first configure your cache cluster, and then configure your ASP.NET application for caching using the Caching NuGet package as described in <link><linkText>Getting Started with In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: state provider, first configure your cache cluster, and then configure your ASP.NET application for caching using the Caching NuGet package as described in <link><linkText>Getting Started with In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When the Caching NuGet package is installed, it adds a commented out section in web.config that contains the required configuration for your ASP.NET application to use the Session State Provider for In-Role Cache.
trans-unit.target: When the Caching NuGet package is installed, it adds a commented out section in web.config that contains the required configuration for your ASP.NET application to use the Session State Provider for In-Role Cache.

trans-unit.source: If your web.config does not contain this commented out section after installing the Caching NuGet package, ensure that the latest NuGet Package Manager is installed from <link><linkText>NuGet Package Manager Installation[]</linkText><title></title></link>, and then uninstall and reinstall the package.
trans-unit.target: If your web.config does not contain this commented out section after installing the Caching NuGet package, ensure that the latest NuGet Package Manager is installed from <link><linkText>NuGet Package Manager Installation[]</linkText><title></title></link>, and then uninstall and reinstall the package.

trans-unit.source: To enable the Session State Provider for In-Role Cache, uncomment the specified section.
trans-unit.target: To enable the Session State Provider for In-Role Cache, uncomment the specified section.

trans-unit.source: The default cache is specified in the provided snippet.
trans-unit.target: The default cache is specified in the provided snippet.

trans-unit.source: To use a different cache, specify the desired cache in the cacheName attribute.
trans-unit.target: To use a different cache, specify the desired cache in the cacheName attribute.

trans-unit.source: For more information about using the Caching service session state
trans-unit.target: For more information about using the Caching service session state

trans-unit.source: provider, see <link><linkText>Session State Provider for In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: provider, see <link><linkText>Session State Provider for In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: How To: Store ASP.NET Page Output Caching in the Cache
trans-unit.target: How To: Store ASP.NET Page Output Caching in the Cache

trans-unit.source: The Output Cache Provider for In-Role Cache is an out-of-process storage mechanism for output cache data.
trans-unit.target: The Output Cache Provider for In-Role Cache is an out-of-process storage mechanism for output cache data.

trans-unit.source: This data is specifically for full HTTP
trans-unit.target: This data is specifically for full HTTP

trans-unit.source: responses (page output caching).
trans-unit.target: responses (page output caching).

trans-unit.source: The provider plugs into the new output
trans-unit.target: The provider plugs into the new output

trans-unit.source: cache provider extensibility point that was introduced in ASP.NET 4.
trans-unit.target: cache provider extensibility point that was introduced in ASP.NET 4.

trans-unit.source: To
trans-unit.target: To

trans-unit.source: use the output cache provider, first configure your cache cluster, and then configure your ASP.NET application for caching using the Caching NuGet package, as described in <link><linkText>Getting Started with In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: use the output cache provider, first configure your cache cluster, and then configure your ASP.NET application for caching using the Caching NuGet package, as described in <link><linkText>Getting Started with In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: When the Caching NuGet package is installed, it adds the following commented out section in web.config that contains the required configuration for your ASP.NET application to use the Output Cache Provider for In-Role Cache.
trans-unit.target: When the Caching NuGet package is installed, it adds the following commented out section in web.config that contains the required configuration for your ASP.NET application to use the Output Cache Provider for In-Role Cache.

trans-unit.source: If your web.config does not contain this commented out section after installing the Caching NuGet package, ensure that the latest NuGet Package Manager is installed from <link><linkText>NuGet Package Manager Installation[]</linkText><title></title></link>, and then uninstall and reinstall the package.
trans-unit.target: If your web.config does not contain this commented out section after installing the Caching NuGet package, ensure that the latest NuGet Package Manager is installed from <link><linkText>NuGet Package Manager Installation[]</linkText><title></title></link>, and then uninstall and reinstall the package.

trans-unit.source: To enable the Output Cache Provider for In-Role Cache, uncomment the specified section.
trans-unit.target: To enable the Output Cache Provider for In-Role Cache, uncomment the specified section.

trans-unit.source: The default cache is specified in the provided snippet.
trans-unit.target: The default cache is specified in the provided snippet.

trans-unit.source: To use a different cache, specify the desired cache in the cacheName attribute.
trans-unit.target: To use a different cache, specify the desired cache in the cacheName attribute.

trans-unit.source: Add an OutputCache directive to each page for which you wish to cache the output.
trans-unit.target: Add an OutputCache directive to each page for which you wish to cache the output.

trans-unit.source: In this example the cached page data will remain in the cache for 60 seconds, and a different version of the page will be cached for each parameter combination.
trans-unit.target: In this example the cached page data will remain in the cache for 60 seconds, and a different version of the page will be cached for each parameter combination.

trans-unit.target: For more information on the available options, see <link><linkText>OutputCache Directive[]</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.target: For more information about using the Output Cache Provider for In-Role Cache, see <link><linkText>Output Cache Provider for In-Role Cache[]</linkText><title></title></link>.
